availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Kelly (Harlan and Clay County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Harlan and Clay County, Kentucky, farmer. Harlan County, Kentucky, native. Married to Jane Cope Kelly in Harlan County on January 12, 1849. Father of Benjamin F. Kelly, Elizabeth Kelly, Drucilla Kelly, Joseph Kelly, William Kelly, John Kelly, Wright Kelly, Martha Kelly, and Sarah Kelly. Farmer in Harlan County in 1850. Farmer in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 1, p. 14B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 96.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 4, p. 26A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harlan County Marriages, Film 000834238.
"William B. Kelly," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), February 25, 1916, p. 5.
"William B. Kelly (1819-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5574373, accessed November 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5574373.
